thread.title: Moto G5 and G5 Plus plus leaked in new images
thread.title_full: Moto G5 and G5 Plus plus leaked in new images

title: Moto G5 and G5 Plus plus leaked in new images
text:
Moto G5 and G5 Plus plus leaked in new images Moto G5 and G5 Plus plus leaked in new images By February 22, 2017 “The Moto G5 and G5 Plus will offer a premium metal design and Android Nougat” 
Earlier this month, the Moto G5 and Moto G5 Plus were spotted on a retailer’s website complete with specs and images. Lenovo is expected to unveil the phones ahead of MWC in Barcelona. Now just a few of days ahead of the launch, a couple of live images of the Moto G5 and a press render of the Moto G5 Plus have hit the interwebs. 
As per the live images, the Moto G5 will feature a rear panel made out of metal. The phone will feature a round-shaped camera housing with a dual LED flash. It will get an oval-shaped physical button, which is expected to hide a fingerprint sensor beneath. Lastly, the live images reveal that the device will boot Android 7.0 Nougat out of the box. 
As for the Moto G5 Plus leak, the popular gadget tipster Evan Blass has posted a press render of the phone, which is heading to the subscribers of Verizon in the US. The phone appears to have a similar design as the Moto G5. 
As per the earlier reports, the Moto G5 will feature a 5-inch full HD display, a Snapdragon 430 SoC, 2GB of RAM, 32GB of storage, a 13MP rear snapper, a 5MP front shooter and a 2,800mAh battery with 10W rapid charging support. The Moto G5 Plus is expected to come with a 5.2-inch full HD display, a Snapdragon 625 SoC, 64GB of storage, a 12MP rear snapper, NFC and a 3,000mAh battery with support for TurboPower charging. We will have their official specs and pricing details at the launch event on February 26th.
